citations.narrative:
A developed and complete contingency plan was not available at time of inspection. Failure to have a complete and
comprehensive written contingency plan can result in lack of readiness for emergencies or disasters which could impact
animal health and well-being. Facilities must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane
handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster.
Additionally, all annual review documentation and training records must be made available during inspection.
Correct by 08/22/2023.

Two adjacent outdoor, animal pens housing goats, llamas and alpacas did not provide sufficient shade for the number of
housed animals. There was a shelter structure present in each pen; however, these structures did not adequately provide
enough shade to comfortably protect all the animals from direct sunlight. Outdoor enclosures with inadequate shade may
cause overheating or discomfort of the animals. Sufficient shade by natural or artificial means must be provided to all
animals kept outdoors to protect themselves from the direct sunlight.
Correct by 08/22/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.38(l)(1) 
   
Miscellaneous. 
A developed and complete contingency plan was not available at time of inspection. Failure to have a complete and 
comprehensive written contingency plan can result in lack of readiness for emergencies or disasters which could impact 
animal health and well-being. Facilities must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane 
handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. 
Additionally, all annual review documentation and training records must be made available during inspection. 
 
Correct by 08/22/2023. 
3.127(a) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
Two adjacent outdoor, animal pens housing goats, llamas and alpacas did not provide sufficient shade for the number of 
housed animals. There was a shelter structure present in each pen; however, these structures did not adequately provide 
enough shade to comfortably protect all the animals from direct sunlight. Outdoor enclosures with inadequate shade may 
cause overheating or discomfort of the animals. Sufficient shade by natural or artificial means must be provided to all 
animals kept outdoors to protect themselves from the direct sunlight. 
 
Correct by 08/22/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
